definition: to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
day/sky/heaven

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: " The Fantasticks" has only 8 actors. There are only 2 musicians.
sentences.chinese: “異想天開”只有8個演員和2名伴奏人員。

sentences.english: It suddenly occurred to the bird that it was the most fantastic idea for birds to catch up with man.
sentences.chinese: 它恍然明白，鳥意欲趕追人類是多麼異想天開。

sentences.english: Is this a fact-based forecast or wishful thinking?
sentences.chinese: 這是基於事實的展望或異想天開？

sentences.english: Not all stories are so whimsical.
sentences.chinese: 當然，並非所有的故事都是如此的異想天開。

sentences.english: I wanted it to feel punchy and whimsical.
sentences.chinese: 我想讓她的房間看起來強大的且異想天開的。

sentences.english: Bourdon is so eager to get back to the stage he is literally dreaming about it.
sentences.chinese: 彈簧是如此渴望回到舞臺上，他簡直是異想天開。

sentences.english: 20 years ago, Internet popularization by the human was also thought is indulges in fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 20年前，互聯網的普及還被人認爲是異想天開。

sentences.english: At first blush Mr Nasheed's notion seems a bit over the top.
sentences.chinese: 乍一聽，納希德總統的想法似乎有點異想天開。

sentences.english: Is it the skyscraper of the future, or just a pie-in-the-sky idea?
sentences.chinese: 這是未來的摩天大樓，還是一個異想天開的想法？

sentences.english: This bob is best for that whimsical and soft look.
sentences.chinese: 這款髮型適合異想天開的溫柔的人羣。

sentences.english: Dog people are horrified at the very idea of choosing a moggy (cat) instead of a pooch (dog).
sentences.chinese: 而愛狗的人一聽養貓這個異想天開的主意就嚇一跳。

sentences.english: It was a wild idea at the time. Few people understood it.
sentences.chinese: 這在當時是一個異想天開的設想，幾乎無人理解。

sentences.english: He's always got his head in the clouds-he makes all these impossible plans.
sentences.chinese: 他總愛異想天開，擬出全部這些做不到的方案。

sentences.english: If is to have fantastic idea, only with one chamber youth red-blooded that is very not enough.
sentences.chinese: 如果是異想天開，僅憑一腔青年熱血那是很不夠的。

definition: to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
Chinese style/à la chinoise
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
visitor/(psychological counseling) client
to enchant/fascinating
a common occurrence (idiom)
hard to believe/incredible
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
to provide food for thought (idiom)/thought-provoking
political correctness/politically correct
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
stupefied/flabbergasted
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
